div.span: Governor Wolf Updated School Closure Information

span.style: font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px

span.span: Governor Wolf closed schools in Pennsylvania indefinitely. On April 6, 2020, the District began to provide remote instruction to students in grades K-12. Please click the following link to access the Brentwood Borough School District's Continuity of Education Plan,

span.style: font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px
font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px

span.span: . The COE plan will be updated throughout the remainder of the school year, as needed.

img.title: Free Meals Still Available While Closed
img.alt: The Nutrition Group is Still Serving Lunches

div.span: The Nutrition Group is Still Serving Lunches

span.span: In response to Governor Wolf's directive that all Pennsylvania schools close through Friday, March 27, 2020, the district will be providing free breakfast and lunch to any students who may be in need.

br.span: NEW! School Cafe - Point of Sale Service for the Cafeteria

span.p: The 2019-2020 school year begins for students on Monday, August 26, 2019. To register your child, please contact Ms. Kiersten McGee at 412-881-2227 ext. 2215.
